meanings.definition: Avoiding or escaping from something, especially by deceit or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky fox was evading capture by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved after successfully evading the tricky obstacle course.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was evading the watchful eyes of the park ranger.
meanings.sent4: The elusive magician seemed to be evading all attempts to uncover his secrets.
meanings.sent5: The clever spy was skilled at evading detection by changing disguises frequently.

meanings.definition: Dodging or eluding something, such as a question or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: He kept evading the teacher's questions by pretending to be busy with his books.
meanings.sent2: The politician was skilled at evading difficult inquiries during the press conference.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was evading the attempts to put it in a bath.
meanings.sent4: The elusive suspect was evading the police by constantly changing locations.
meanings.sent5: The clever hare was evading the hunter by zigzagging through the forest.
